definition.gco:CharacterString: high-level geographic data thematic classification to assist in the grouping and search of available geographic data sets. Can be used to group keywords as well. Listed examples are not exhaustive. NOTE: It is understood there are overlaps between general categories and the user is encouraged to select the one most appropriate.

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: high-level geographic data thematic classification to assist in the grouping and search of available geographic data sets. Can be used to group keywords as well. Listed examples are not exhaustive. NOTE: It is understood there are overlaps between general categories and the user is encouraged to select the one most appropriate.

definition.gco:CharacterString: rearing of animals and/or cultivation of plants. Examples: agriculture, irrigation, aquaculture, plantations, herding, pests and diseases affecting crops and livestock

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: rearing of animals and/or cultivation of plants. Examples: agriculture, irrigation, aquaculture, plantations, herding, pests and diseases affecting crops and livestock

definition.gco:CharacterString: flora and/or fauna in natural environment. Examples: wildlife, vegetation, biological sciences, ecology, wilderness, sealife, wetlands, habitat

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: flora and/or fauna in natural environment. Examples: wildlife, vegetation, biological sciences, ecology, wilderness, sealife, wetlands, habitat

definition.gco:CharacterString: legal land descriptions, maritime boundaries. Examples: political and administrative boundaries, territorial seas, EEZ, port security zones

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: legal land descriptions, maritime boundaries. Examples: political and administrative boundaries, territorial seas, EEZ, port security zones

definition.gco:CharacterString: processes and phenomena of the atmosphere. Examples: cloud cover, weather, climate, atmospheric conditions, climate change, precipitation

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: processes and phenomena of the atmosphere. Examples: cloud cover, weather, climate, atmospheric conditions, climate change, precipitation

definition.gco:CharacterString: economic activities, conditions and employment. Examples: production, labour, revenue, commerce, industry, tourism and ecotourism, forestry, fisheries, commercial or subsistence hunting, exploration and exploitation of resources such as minerals, oil and gas

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: economic activities, conditions and employment. Examples: production, labour, revenue, commerce, industry, tourism and ecotourism, forestry, fisheries, commercial or subsistence hunting, exploration and exploitation of resources such as minerals, oil and gas

definition.gco:CharacterString: height above or below a vertical datum. Examples: altitude, bathymetry, digital elevation models, slope, derived products

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: height above or below a vertical datum. Examples: altitude, bathymetry, digital elevation models, slope, derived products

definition.gco:CharacterString: environmental resources, protection and conservation. Examples: environmental pollution, waste storage and treatment, environmental impact assessment, monitoring environmental risk, nature reserves, landscape

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: environmental resources, protection and conservation. Examples: environmental pollution, waste storage and treatment, environmental impact assessment, monitoring environmental risk, nature reserves, landscape

definition.gco:CharacterString: information pertaining to earth sciences. Examples: geophysical features and processes, geology, minerals, sciences dealing with the composition, structure and origin of the earth's rocks, risks of earthquakes, volcanic activity, landslides, gravity information, soils, permafrost, hydrogeology, erosion

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: information pertaining to earth sciences. Examples: geophysical features and processes, geology, minerals, sciences dealing with the composition, structure and origin of the earth's rocks, risks of earthquakes, volcanic activity, landslides, gravity information, soils, permafrost, hydrogeology, erosion

definition.gco:CharacterString: health, health services, human ecology, and safety. Examples: disease and illness, factors affecting health, hygiene, substance abuse, mental and physical health, health services

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: health, health services, human ecology, and safety. Examples: disease and illness, factors affecting health, hygiene, substance abuse, mental and physical health, health services

definition.gco:CharacterString: base maps. Examples: land cover, topographic maps, imagery, unclassified images, annotations

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: base maps. Examples: land cover, topographic maps, imagery, unclassified images, annotations

definition.gco:CharacterString: military bases, structures, activities. Examples: barracks, training grounds, military transportation, information collection

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: military bases, structures, activities. Examples: barracks, training grounds, military transportation, information collection

definition.gco:CharacterString: inland water features, drainage systems and their characteristics. Examples: rivers and glaciers, salt lakes, water utilization plans, dams, currents, floods, water quality, hydrologic information

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: inland water features, drainage systems and their characteristics. Examples: rivers and glaciers, salt lakes, water utilization plans, dams, currents, floods, water quality, hydrologic information

definition.gco:CharacterString: positional information and services. Examples: addresses, geodetic networks, control points, postal zones and services, place names

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: positional information and services. Examples: addresses, geodetic networks, control points, postal zones and services, place names

definition.gco:CharacterString: features and characteristics of salt water bodies (excluding inland waters) Examples: tides, tsunamis, coastal information, reefs

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: features and characteristics of salt water bodies (excluding inland waters) Examples: tides, tsunamis, coastal information, reefs

definition.gco:CharacterString: information used for appropriate actions for future use of the land. Examples: land use maps, zoning maps, cadastral surveys, land ownership

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: information used for appropriate actions for future use of the land. Examples: land use maps, zoning maps, cadastral surveys, land ownership

definition.gco:CharacterString: characteristics of society and cultures. Examples: settlements, anthropology, archaeology, education, traditional beliefs, manners and customs, demographic data, recreational areas and activities, social impact assessments, crime and justice, census information

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: characteristics of society and cultures. Examples: settlements, anthropology, archaeology, education, traditional beliefs, manners and customs, demographic data, recreational areas and activities, social impact assessments, crime and justice, census information

definition.gco:CharacterString: man-made construction. Examples: buildings, museums, churches, factories, housing, monuments, shops, towers

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: man-made construction. Examples: buildings, museums, churches, factories, housing, monuments, shops, towers

definition.gco:CharacterString: means and aids for conveying persons and/or goods. Examples: roads, airports/airstrips, shipping routes, tunnels, nautical charts, vehicle or vessel location, aeronautical charts, railways

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: means and aids for conveying persons and/or goods. Examples: roads, airports/airstrips, shipping routes, tunnels, nautical charts, vehicle or vessel location, aeronautical charts, railways

definition.gco:CharacterString: energy, water and waste systems and communications infrastructure and services. Examples: hydroelectricity, geothermal, solar and nuclear sources of energy, water purification and distribution, sewage collection and disposal, electricity and gas distribution, data communication, telecommunication, radio, communication networks

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: energy, water and waste systems and communications infrastructure and services. Examples: hydroelectricity, geothermal, solar and nuclear sources of energy, water purification and distribution, sewage collection and disposal, electricity and gas distribution, data communication, telecommunication, radio, communication networks

definition.gco:CharacterString: region more than 100 km above the surface of the Earth

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: region more than 100 km above the surface of the Earth

definition.gco:CharacterString: Information related to disasters. Examples: site of the disaster, evacuation zone, disaster-prevention facility, disaster relief activities

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: Information related to disasters. Examples: site of the disaster, evacuation zone, disaster-prevention facility, disaster relief activities

definition.gco:CharacterString: degree of complexity of the spatial relationships

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: degree of complexity of the spatial relationships

definition.gco:CharacterString: geometry objects without any additional structure which describes topology

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: geometry objects without any additional structure which describes topology

definition.gco:CharacterString: 1-dimensional topological complex; commonly called 'chain-node' topology

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: 1-dimensional topological complex; commonly called 'chain-node' topology

definition.gco:CharacterString: 1-dimensional topological complex that is planar. (A planar graph is a graph that can be drawn in a plane in such a way that no two edges intersect except at a vertex.)

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: 1-dimensional topological complex that is planar. (A planar graph is a graph that can be drawn in a plane in such a way that no two edges intersect except at a vertex.)

definition.gco:CharacterString: 2-dimensional topological complex that is planar. (A 2-dimensional topological complex is commonly called 'full topology' in a cartographic 2D environment.)

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: 2-dimensional topological complex that is planar. (A 2-dimensional topological complex is commonly called 'full topology' in a cartographic 2D environment.)

definition.gco:CharacterString: 1-dimensional topological complex that is isomorphic to a subset of a surface. (A geometric complex is isomorphic to a topological complex if their elements are in a one-to-one, dimensional-and boundary-preserving correspondence to one another.)

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: 1-dimensional topological complex that is isomorphic to a subset of a surface. (A geometric complex is isomorphic to a topological complex if their elements are in a one-to-one, dimensional-and boundary-preserving correspondence to one another.)

definition.gco:CharacterString: 2-dimensional topological complex that is isomorphic to a subset of a surface

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: 2-dimensional topological complex that is isomorphic to a subset of a surface

definition.gco:CharacterString: 3-dimensional topological complex. (A topological complex is a collection of topological primitives that are closed under the boundary operations.)

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: 3-dimensional topological complex. (A topological complex is a collection of topological primitives that are closed under the boundary operations.)

definition.gco:CharacterString: complete coverage of a 3D Euclidean coordinate space

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: complete coverage of a 3D Euclidean coordinate space

definition.gco:CharacterString: topological complex without any specified geometric realisation

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: topological complex without any specified geometric realisation

definition.gco:CharacterString: type of coupling between service and associated data (if exists)

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: type of coupling between service and associated data (if exists)

definition.gco:CharacterString: service instance is loosely coupled with a data instance, i.e. no MD_DataIdentification class has to be described

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: service instance is loosely coupled with a data instance, i.e. no MD_DataIdentification class has to be described

definition.gco:CharacterString: service instance is mixed coupled with a data instance, i.e. MD_DataIdentification describes the associated data instance and additionally the service instance might work with other external data instances

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: service instance is mixed coupled with a data instance, i.e. MD_DataIdentification describes the associated data instance and additionally the service instance might work with other external data instances

definition.gco:CharacterString: service instance is tightly coupled with a data instance, i.e. MD_DataIdentification class MUST be described

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: service instance is tightly coupled with a data instance, i.e. MD_DataIdentification class MUST be described

definition.gco:CharacterString: class of information to which the referencing entity applies

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: class of information to which the referencing entity applies

definition.gco:CharacterString: the parameter is an input parameter to the service instance

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: the parameter is an input parameter to the service instance

definition.gco:CharacterString: the parameter is an output parameter to the service instance

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: the parameter is an output parameter to the service instance

definition.gco:CharacterString: the parameter is both an input and output parameter to the service instance

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: the parameter is both an input and output parameter to the service instance
